abstract: On Twitter, protesters in the Occupy movement explain what motivated them to join.
snippet: On Twitter, protesters in the Occupy movement explain what motivated them to join.
lead_paragraph: An article by Marc Lacey in Tuesday's New York Times looked at the many different issues motivating protesters in America and abroad to join the growing Occupy Wall Street movement. Reporting on protesters around the country, Mr. Lacey found that not every group or individual that has embraced Occupy marches for the same reasons. Though many protesters seem united in feeling that a system designed to benefit the rich and connected is not working in their favor, many are also more concerned with specific challenges affecting their local communities, such as education and the environment.
